newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Creative says wins appeal vs Aztech.
newsitem.headline: Creative says wins appeal vs Aztech.

text.p: Computer sound-card maker Creative Technology Ltd said on Wednesday the Court of Appeal of Singapore had ruled that Aztech Systems Ltd had infringed the copyright of Creative's "Sound Blaster" firmware.
Creative said in a statement the court reversed on Tuesday an earlier decision by the Singapore High Court to dismiss Creative's claim against Aztech.
It said the court also ruled that Aztech's disassembly of Creative's copyrighted product did not constitute fair use.
The statement gave no other details of the ruling and did not say whether a previous court order that Creative pay costs estimated at over Singapore $1.0 million had been overturned.
In a separate statement Aztech confirmed that the Court of Appeal had set aside the high court judgment and said it was seeking legal advice.
Creative quoted its chairman and chief executive officer, Sim Wong Hoo, as welcoming the ruling. The company would continue to pursue those who infringed its intellectual property rights, he said.

In 1995, Singapore's High Court ruled Aztech's "Sound Galaxy" sound cards did not infringe Creative's copyright and ordered Creative to pay certain Aztech court costs. At the time, Aztech estimated the costs at more that S$1.0 million.
